text.div:
SHR Informant Extension

The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.

name: SHR Informant Extension
title: SHR Informant Extension
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.

element.definition: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

shr-base-Informant-extension SHALL have either extension('string') or extension('patient') or extension('group') or extension('device') or extension('participant') or extension('relatedperson') or extension('organization')
constraint.expression: ( extension('string').url | extension('patient').url | extension('group').url | extension('device').url | extension('participant').url | extension('relatedperson').url | extension('organization').url ).distinct().count() == 1

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
An Extension
The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.
A person in the role of a patient, including extended demographic information about the subject of this health record.
A set of entities (personnel, material, or places) to be considered together. May be a pool of like-type resources, a team, or combination of personnel, material and places.
A specific durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment. The value is the coding for a type of device, for example, a CPAP machine. The same device might be used on multiple patients.
An object (usually a Person, Party, or Organization but potentially a device or other Entity) that participates in a task or activity.
A person in a role defined in relationship to a patient
A social or legal structure formed by human beings.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
